definition: letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: Today, Braille is in nearly every language around the world.
sentences.chinese: 今天，布拉耶盲字已用于全世界几乎每一种语言。

sentences.english: A Braille code for English was not adopted until 1932.
sentences.chinese: 直到1932年英语国家才普遍接受布拉耶盲字。

definition: Chinese character/CL:個|个[ge4]/Japanese: kanji/Korean: hanja/Vietnamese: hán tự
indexing system for Chinese characters in a dictionary
simplified Chinese character, as opposed to traditional Chinese character 繁體字|繁体字[fan2 ti3 zi4]
to indicate the pronunciation of Chinese characters using Pinyin or Bopomofo etc/phonetic notation/(specifically) Bopomofo (abbr. for 注音符號|注音符号[zhu4 yin1 fu2 hao4])
standard form of a Chinese character/(Tw) traditional (i.e. unsimplified) characters
Hanyu Pinyin, the romanization system used in the PRC since the 1960s
character having several readings and meanings
new character (in textbook)/character that is unfamiliar or not yet studied
component of a Chinese character (as the radical or the phonetic part)
